intro: Lupinus densiflorus var. versabilis, commonly known as the variable lupine, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its dense clusters of blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several oval-shaped leaflets, and it has a fibrous root system that helps fix nitrogen in the soil. This variety is notable for its adaptability to different soil conditions and its role in ecological restoration projects.
